Reviews.Title: “Everything worked, expectations met..”
Reviews.Author: neilyork
Reviews.Content: I've come to the conclusion, through years of travel, that a hotel either meets my expectations or it doesn't. For the money paid, I thought this place was fab value. I paid extra for the wifi which worked flawlessly. The room was clean, bright and modern - it didn't actually feel that basic to be fair.. The room was quiet and I got a good nights sleep. It is a little out of the town but then if it was closer it would be very expensive like all other Amsterdam hotels. I like the easyhotel proposition - it does what it says on the tin - in bright orange!

Reviews.Title: “standard to poor level of comfort but clean”
Reviews.Author: RelaxationLondon
Reviews.Content: If you are sharing a twin room with someone you know slightly it's not ideal to have the toilet in the room with just a sheet of glass diving you from the beds. It was pokey and we were tripping over each other to move around the small room

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: isabelbarbedo
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, basic, small but comfortable. You have to pay for the extras, but we knew that from the description on its site. The air conditioning has a very annoying sound at nightime, but if you turn it off, you`ll have a very quiet night, with very comfy pillow and mattress. There`s a bakery "ron Verboom" around the corner that you have discount because of the hotel, with very tasty cakes and you have a Subway nearby. The tram station is across the street, number 25, that takes straight to the dam or cental station (you can buy a ticket on the tram or @ Cental St. ), in more less 15 minutes. The Heineken is a 5 min. walk and the Van gogh and Reijkavik museums are 10 min. walk. The tv is 5 euros, hairdrayer 2euros and the lockers 5euros.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: javaboy1
Reviews.Content: We were there as a couple for 5 nights. We don't have a complaint at all. Clean, adequate, pleasant staff, and great value. What more do you want? Sure, a bit more space would have been nice, but really - if you don't know what you are getting at an EasyHotel you haven't done your homework. They have good size lockers for rent - 5 euros per day - this was handy as you'll want to store your bags while you see the city awaiting checkin at 3. The neighbourhood is lovely - we were always glad to escape the city centre - a bit too tourist-tacky at times, and return to this part of town. Tram 25 stops right outside the door. Le Pain Quotidien just up Bolstraat is a great place for a coffee and pastry. When you come out the door of the hotel, go left and at the end of the block is a great pizza place. All locals - they don't even have an English menu. But they are really friendly and helpful. Ahh, Amsterdam. can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not good”
Reviews.Author: btminzon
Reviews.Content: The hotel installations are pretty new. The bedroom are clen, the bathroom as well. The staff, in general, are polite (except one blond woman that is definitely not polite) and the easy of access is good. Good locations, there is a Tran stop in front of the hotel, the region is safe to walk at night, and there is a lot of bakeries around. In my bedroom, there was only 2 beds, and, as went with my wife, we removed the mattress and slept both in the floor. The mattress is really good. Only towels for shower: not for face neither for floor. My wife needed to rent a hair dryer in front desk for â‚¬2. The air conditioning is also good. The price is affordable (â‚¬59 per night) too. I had to pay â‚¬29 per week to use internet and TV. The TV program is really good, with lots of international channels. The internet is not bad, but only one device is allowed to connect at time, what is not good.

Reviews.Title: “Like being in a sealed crate”
Reviews.Author: Londonfields
Reviews.Content: If your idea of a hotel is a sealed room with no natural air, or in some cases, light, then this is the place for you. But I don't like rattling air-con systems, or not being able to open a window, so for me it was just awful. The temperature gauge was also dodgy, so altho we put it onto max, we both froze. On night three, the staff did agree to let us change room, so that at least we had natural light, which was something, as the window of the first room looked out onto an internal corridor. It's true that this hotel doesn't cost much, and the staff were pretty nice. But nothing would induce me to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donstallione
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this hotel is not luxurious, it is very basic. You have to pay extra for everything like early check in, internet etc (There is a cheap internet cafe just across the road). But all of these extra charges are stated clearly on the website.( Don't bother paying for the T.V It sucks, the Movie package is better) But what you do get is a spotlessly clean, safe hotel in a good area, near to the Albert cuyp market, supermarket, Tram stops, locals coffeeshops, great bars for the same price as what a hostel bed would cost you. I got the rate of 29 Euros per night in February and I could safely say that I would definitely stay there again. No it's not romantic or luxurious but it's in a charming area away from the touristy part of Amsterdam and it's very smart and great value and the staff were really friendly too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rebecca f
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a weekend away with some friends. It is a little out the center but a tram travels from the centre to right outside the hotel every ten minutes and 24hr passes for the tram arer only 7.50. We could check in until three but the let us leave our bags there from 10am, when leaving we had to check out by 10.30am but again they let us leave our bags until 4pm. The rooms are small but very clean with reallllllyyyy comfty beds and great showers. The staff were very helpful and give you a discount card for local restaurants. I would recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: FelipeZC
Reviews.Content: I've just check out from the hotel. In the begging I was not so sure about my choice but it worth it. The hotel is really simple, but clean and brand new. It was a place with no luxury but that's what I expected for the price I payed. If you are coming for a honeymoon or to relax in a hotel, that's not the place. But with you are coming to walk around the city and what you want from a hotel is a comfortable bed and shower, that's the place.

Reviews.Title: “Just as Expected !”
Reviews.Author: mrnpar
Reviews.Content: Easyhotel as we all know is a hotel with basic accommodation. The room was very beautyful and clean. I had not paid the housekeeping fee as I stayed for only five days. The ups and the downs... The area is safe, close to a supermarket and close to every amentity required. Tram stations just outside and a great bakery around the corner to have breakfast. :) the reception staff was helpfull. I booked the deluxe room and the room was great, clean and quiet but not much spacy and as described. I mean it's an easyhotel. The common areas were again clean. The downs are that no towels, tv and no wifi unless you pay. No window in the room and no place to put your staff. there was only one hunger to place our coats but this wasn't a problem for me, our things were in our bags. Addiotionally there is no privacy between the wc and the room. There is only one glass door between the toilet-shower and the room and every noise you will make... the other in the room will hear it for sure!! I had no problems generally and I just wanted a place to sleep. It was perfect for me and with the price of 40eu per day I could not complain and I was super satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan on staying more than one night”
Reviews.Author: Grace O
Reviews.Content: Perfect ofr our needs, one night in Amsterdam. Good location, a short tram ride to the city centre or a nice 20 minute walk. Close to good cafes, pubs and the Heinekein experience. Cheap and spotlessly clean. Friendly staff at reception. However........ We arrived before the ridiculously late check in time of 3pm so had to pay â‚¬7.50 for the luxury of early check in. The rooms are small, but very clean. Extra towels are â‚¬1, There's a tv, but it only works if you pay â‚¬5. Wi-fi is â‚¬7.50, having your room cleaned is â‚¬15, you get the idea. Its like the Ryanair of hotels. You need to be very aware of all the add-ons before you arrive and I recommend not staying longer than one night, then you avoid paying for housekeeping!

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: Darryl N
Reviews.Content: VERY basic, small, Clean, Fresh and modern. However, make sure you bring an extra 100 euros for the things they do not include in the price, For example, towels, TV, WIFI, room cleaning and the list goes on. Service was very good, but again i was disappointed that I asked for our shower to be fixed on the first night and it never did get fixed after a further two times asking them, Excuse, "i told the man but he is coming today" this is what i was told when checking out. Convenient? So in my opinion, if your looking for a place to rest your head for one night, easy hotel is good. If not i would not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “EasyStay!”
Reviews.Author: TartanSeagull
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 nite with a friend on the 14th Feb as somewhere to get some sleep enroute from Edinburgh to Antwerp. We got a twin room for 29 Euros! - Bargain. We found the room bigger than what we expected and the 'glass' bathroom 'in the room' is not a problem.The room was really clean and overall we were pleasantly surprised, considering some of the poor reviews on here.....for 14/15 Euros a nite, what are people expecting?! You pay twice that for a bed in a dorm on the Danmark! There are bars, bakerys & a Subway outiside the Hotel and the trams go every 10-15 mins into Dam Square from 06:00 - 01:00...(ish!) If you arrive into Central Station...come out of the Main Entrance and walk right for about 1 min. Take Tram 25 to the Hotel. you can pay on the Tram. I am returning to Amsterdam in June with my wife for 3 days and we have booked to stay here again, so that in itself makes this Hotel a winner for me.

Reviews.Title: “You pay nothing, you get nothing...”
Reviews.Author: rcsmit
Reviews.Content: ... but what you get is okay. If you want something more than standard, you have to pay (known), so calculate well. EasyHotel is very known for their yieldmanagement so you can get very good prices. But if you can get another hotel for the same price (or a bit more), think twice. Unfortunately the airco and the airsystem of the douche make a lot of noise alll night long (and can't be switched off). Receptionists are kind.

Reviews.Title: “think again before booking!”
Reviews.Author: johonnyman
Reviews.Content: this is sort of hotel for the people who does only need clean, quite and warm place to stay for short time. I read the comments about this hotel at here wihich was ok, some people say its terrible but I thought these people does not have appreciation. However they were right! rooms are ridiculous shower and wc ine the glass cabin, rom are noisy and much more worst iso its FREEZING cold, your can complain about it but they simply ignore you! moreover there is charge for everything and check in time is 3pm if your come early your must pay early check in fee. All in all guys try not to book this place if your dont wanna wake up with running nose and frozen face.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and cheap”
Reviews.Author: jozseffekete
Reviews.Content: CHEAP AND DISCOUNTED PRICE. Fast check in and out, service just for extra money (known). Small room (known), 1 bed-linen for 2 people, some blood on the duvet, lot of hair in the bed, capillary paperwalls, unopening window, the "bedroom" is separated from the bathroom by just a glas, no toilet brush, super shower. 1 min. to tram 25, 20 min. to central station by tram (EUR 2,6/ pers.) You must beware of this hotel if you are a new couple. Highly recommended for the budget travellers, 1 room, 2 nights, EUR 52.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: lonzie
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Amsterdam and you are on a budget then this is your place, the rooms are small but as it is very new it's clean and tidy. It is in a good location, very very close to a tram that takes you to Dam Square and the main train station or you can walk if you fancy it - Dam Square can be reached in 30 mins or so. It is situated near bars and restaurants and a laundrette, the hotel even issues you with a discount card offering money off some local establishments. Don't expect luxury but if you want a place that's clean, well located and cheap then this is for you

Reviews.Title: “Good value modern city hotel”
Reviews.Author: adk1968
Reviews.Content: I have travelled on Easyjet many times but this was the first Easyhotel that I have stayed in and I was very happy with the experience. The room was no-frills but had everything that I needed for a city break and was spotlessly clean. The guy on the front desk was extremely helpful and getting to the center of Amsterdam was easy. This is a good value hotel to stay in if you are planning on spending most of your time visiting the sites and nightlife rather than sitting in your room.

Reviews.Title: “not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: misterbigbig
Reviews.Content: Hotel is basic and clean, and quite small, rather cramped as the beds take up the whole room. At night I couldn't sleep well because of the noise of the airco or water system whatever it was that kept me awake. Really basic hotel, ok for young back packers. Quite far away from the city center also and not easy to reach the airport. Clean and new hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PG27
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to Amsterdam for a short/cheap break last week. We stayed at the Easyhotel for 3 nights. The room was small and basic but immaculate and we had a huge window with a good view over a residential area. The shower room is pretty much a glass box in the middle of the bedroom. So be prepared to shuffle around each other as there is not alot of space or privacy. There is a brand new flat screen tv hanging from the ceiling. We paid an extra 5euros for this, but I think it was well worth it. The room also has air conditioning. We basically only slept and showered here - so the hotel was perfect, but probably not ideal for a longer stay. The hotel does not offer a great deal of services but this was not an issue for us. I believe for an extra cost you can have your room cleaned, extra towels, WiFi access and there is lockers to store your luggage. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English (which was good because my Dutch is not so good). I would say that the hotel is slightly off the beaten track - however transport links in Amsterdam are fantastic and it only took 10minutes on a tram to Dam Square. The number 25 goes from literally right outside the front of the hotel . We walked to central station one day and that took around half an hour. To sum up - the hotel was cheap and cheerful and perfect for a short stay in Amsterdam!! I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it for couples or individuals looking for a good value place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: FlaviaMotta
Reviews.Content: Spent a night there with my husband. We got an incredible rate of 39 euro on a last minute deal at booking.com. The hotel is really basic - although with free wi-fi and LCD tv. The room is tiny but clean, enough for a short stay and if you donâ€™t have much luggage. Itâ€™s a 15 minute walk from Leidsplein - full of bars - and in an area with some exotics restaurants. Not close to the train station but has easy tram access. People on the front desk were really nice.

HotelInfo.Name: easyHotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: van Ostadestraat 97, Amsterdam 1072 ST, The Netherlands
